DataElement.preferredName: Quality of Life Unusual Pain Assessment Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether there was an unusual or out of the ordinary sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings as a subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Quality of Life Unusual Pain Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the evaulation of an unusual or out of the ordinary sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings as a subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life.  The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Concepts.definition: The subjective measurement of an individual's sense of well-being and ability to enjoy life. The concept holds varying meanings for different people and may evolve over time. For some individuals it implies autonomy, empowerment, capability, and choice; for others, security, social integration, or freedom from stress or illness.

Property.preferredDefinition: Out of the ordinary, uncommon, or unexpected.:An unpleasant sensation induced by noxious stimuli and generally received by specialized nerve endings.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Out of the ordinary, uncommon, or unexpected.
The sensation of discomfort, distress, or agony, resulting from the stimulation of specialized nerve endings.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: retired; not ISO compliant; all associated CDEs retired

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Throughout our lives, most of
ReferenceDocuments.description: Throughout our lives, most of us have had pain from time to time (such as minor headaches, sprains, and toothaches).  Have you had pain other than these everyday kinds of pain today?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Quality of Life Ind-2 2018322v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator   - dbw
